Title: Date And Time Functions
Description: The datetime(time-value, modifier, modifier, ...) function returns the date and time formatted as YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.SSS if the subsec modifier is used. It accepts a time-value and zero or more modifiers.
Returns: A string formatted as YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.SSS.
Examples: SELECT datetime(); -- Returns the current date and time.
SELECT datetime('now', '+1 hour'); -- Returns the date and time one hour after the current time.
